EmailTemplate.subject: Thank you for joining Pivotal at SpringOne2GX 2015
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi There, Washington DC was an amazing event packed with remarkable, pivotal moments and 1000+ attendees - including engineers from some of the largest websites in the world - Rakuten, Alibaba, and Netflix, among others.
Thanks for joining Pivotal, Spring, and the Groovy and Grails communities at SpringOne2GX 2015 <http://www.springone2gx.com>. We hope you enjoyed learning how enterprises are adopting cloud native application architectures to drive modern, software experiences for their customers. If you’d like a hands-on workshop day in your offices or at a nearby hotel, simply inquire here <http://pivotal.io/cloud-native-workshop> to begin a discussion.
In the meantime, start a cloud native journey on the Cloud Native microsite <http://pivotal.io/cloud-native> to learn why it matters, what it looks like and how to become cloud native. And remember to pick up your free copy of the O’Reilly eBook, Migrating to Cloud Native Applications <http://pivotal.io/platform/migrating-to-cloud-native-application-architectures-ebook> on the Pivotal site.
Stay tuned to email or @springone2gx <https://www.twitter.com/springone2gx> for announcements on SpringOne2GX 2016!
The Cloud Natives are coming….
In case you missed anything, here’s a quick recap:
- The Spring IO Platform offers the industry leading cloud native application framework, via Spring Boot and Spring Cloud - specifically designed for microservices in collaboration with Netflix, and fully integrated into Cloud Foundry’s PaaS and IaaS capabilities. - Spring XD 1.x is being refactored to a microservice architecture and being re-launched as Spring Cloud Dataflow - Spring Framework 4.3 and 5.0 plans announced - Spring team working towards reactive architecture option in Spring Framework 5.0 - JUnit Lambda <http://junit.org/junit-lambda.html> contribution! Pivotal is sponsoring JUnit with a cash donation and time from one of our developers. Consider donating $5.00 yourself - skip a coffee at starbucks, save a unit test! - Partnership intent with Cognizant <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/news/pivotal-and-cognizant-partner-to-drive-cloud-native-development> and First Data <https://pivotal.io/de/platform/press-release/first-data-and-pivotal-team-up> announced - Apache Groovy doubles number of downloads after joining the Apache Software Foundation, with over 7 million downloads since the beginning of the year
SpringOne2GX media coverage:
- InfoQ: High Level Plans for Spring 4.3 and 5.0 Announced at SpringOne2GX <http://www.infoq.com/news/2015/09/spring-43-5> - InfoQ: SpringXD being Re-architected and Re-branded to Spring Cloud Data Flow <http://www.infoq.com/news/2015/09/spring-cloud-data-flow> - InfoQ: Groovy and Grails Plans Announced at SpringOne2GX <http://www.infoq.com/news/2015/09/groovy24-25-grails31> - InfoWorld: Grails gets cozy with Angular.JS for better JavaScript <http://www.infoworld.com/article/2988234/javascript/grails-gets-cozy-with-angularjs-for-better-javascript.html> - JaxEnter: Groovy and Grails updates out of SpringOne2GX conference <https://jaxenter.com/groovy-and-grails-updates-out-of-springone2gx-conference-120847.html> - The New Stack: SpringOne 2GX Conference: Managing and Migrating Monoliths of Mud <http://thenewstack.io/springone-2gx-conference-managing-migrating-monoliths-mud/> - The New Stack: NetflixOSS, Groovy and Grails, and all Things Cloud Native at SpringOne2GX <http://thenewstack.io/tns-analysts-show-60-netflixoss-groovy-and-grails-and-all-things-cloud-native-at-springone-2gx/> - STLToday: Pivotal and OCI join forces to support the Grails community <http://interact.stltoday.com/pr/business/PR091415083823043> - Dzone: Spring Cloud Sidecar <https://dzone.com/articles/spring-cloud-sidecar> - Dzone: Building Cloud Native Apps With Spring: Part 2 <https://dzone.com/articles/building-cloud-native-apps-with-spring-part-2> - PYMNTS: First Data Partners To Streamline Developer ECommerce App Integration <http://www.pymnts.com/news/2015/first-data-partners-to-streamline-developer-ecommerce-app-integration/#.Vg7paBNViko> - TechTarget: Head in the Clouds: SaaS, PaaS, and Cloud Strategy <http://itknowledgeexchange.techtarget.com/cloud-applications/what-not-to-do-in-the-cloud-cloud-anti-patterns/>
Post-conference training through Pivotal Academy: Live Online or In-Person Training:
- Sign up for hands-on Pivotal Academy classes today to build and master your technical proficiency around the latest Pivotal technologies - Choose from a wide array of In-Person classes and many classes available via Pivotal - Academy’s Live Online platform, which allows you to attend online instructor-led training without the time and expense of travel - View our complete portfolio of classes here <http://pivotal.io/academy> and schedule a class today.
Event Slides/Video:
- Slides are available on www.springone2gx.com <http://www.springone2gx.com> (schedule page). Bear in mind some sessions we did not have recording permission or the session was all live demo, resulting in no slides. - Early access video has been up for awhile now. You should have received an email from Pivotal and InfoQ on Tuesday Sept 15th with details on how to access. If you are having any trouble, please contact us via the form on the SpringOne2GX website here <http://springone2gx.com/contact>. - Video rendering for public access is in progress and will be published to the Spring Developer YouTube <http://spring.io/video> channel, and InfoQ <http://www.infoq.com/springone-2gx-2015>. Follow @springcentral and / or @springone2gx for publishing notifications.
Event Photos:
- Event photos are located on the Flickr page <https://www.flickr.com/photos/nofluffjuststuff/albums/72157658272964780>! - Spring framework lead and co-founder Juergen Hoeller announces Pivotal’s crowdfunding support of JUnit during the first keynote.
- And a surprise visit this year, for the first time in 5 years - Dr. Dave Syer, Josh Long and Dr. Rod Johnson, the founder and father of Spring, after his first in-depth Spring Boot and Spring Cloud walk through a few weeks ago. He loved it!
Want more? Stay in touch with Pivotal and join the conversation on our blogs <http://spring.io/blog>, podcasts <http://blog.pivotal.io/podcasts-pivotal>, and on Twitter <http://twitter.com/springcentral>. We hope to see you again soon at a future event <http://pivotal.io/news-events#events>!
